item.title: Donate
item.description:
You can help us out in two ways:

Donating through Comunidad ↗ Donating a used laptop

Comunidad is a 501(c)(3), so giving through them is tax deductible.

We are trying to raise $3,000!

Laptops

We are looking for functional laptops made in the past 10 years, but 5 years or newer is preferable. Please fill out our form if you have a laptop you would like to donate.

item.title: Our Story
item.description:
"Can you teach me?"
– Ricardo Perez, co-founder and inspiration for Willston Web

Willston Web was born of friendship: when expressing his frustration with the monotony of his current job sorting clothes in retail, Ricardo asked Jonathan, "Can you teach me [web development]?" upon hearing about Jonathan's work managing websites. Jonathan had been wondering how he could make web development more accessible and share skills he had developed at his science and technology focused high school, so he was elated to hear Ricardo desired to learn web development and thought that there might be others like him. Together, they are planning the Willston Web bootcamp. Along with increasing access to personal computers and inspiring students to pursue a career in programming, they want to foster a web of students that learn together in a community effort.

item.title: Thanks for subscribing!
item.description: You should receive an email from us in your inbox momentarily asking you to confirm your email. All you need to do is click the link to make sure you get emails from us in the future. Check your junk folder if you don’t see anything from us. Please add jonathan@willston.org to your contacts to ensure our emails won’t end up in your junk folder.

item.title: Your email is confirmed!
item.description:
Thanks for confirming your email. You’ll get updates from us from now on. Please add jonathan@willston.org to your contacts to ensure our emails won’t end up in your junk folder.

Share willston.org with a friend if you’re so inclined!
